alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 9:05PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee...Mississippi...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Memphis affecting Crittenden, Shelby and DeSoto Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Memphis. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, In Arkansas, Dacus Lake Road under the I-55 Bridge begins to flood. Water is encroaching on the levee south of Blue Lake. The road to Island 40 begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.5 feet early Sunday morning. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued tomorrow by 12 PM CST.
